messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] Digest Number 3564
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 5/26/2003 8:52:02 AM Central Daylight Time, ... My poor younger daughter has been  relegated to the back seat (but only for another six
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 5/26/2003 8:52:02 AM Central Daylight Time,
Unschooling-dotcom@yahoogroups.com writes:

> Disclaimer: My son sits up front because of safety issues. He can
> unbuckle
> his belt and unlock the door or crawl out the window too fast for me to
> catch
> him. He's almost seven, VERY impulsive. That said, here's my story:

My poor younger daughter has been relegated to the back seat (but only
for another six months!) for some time, now, since we bought a car with TWO
front-seat airbags.

Before that, we played "Chinese Fire Drill" at every rest stop on vacation
trips. :-)


~~~ Becky~~~

"To announce that there must be no criticism of the president,
or that we are to stand by the president right or wrong, is not only
unpatriotic and servile,
but is morally treasonable to the American public."
---Theodore Roosevelt






[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]
